com.erikartymiuk.badbudgetlogic.main

Class MoneyGain

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.erikartymiuk.badbudgetlogic.main.MoneyGain

  • public class MoneyGain
extends java.lang.Object
    Class representing any sort of money gain, one time or recurring. Examples include a regular paycheck, a one time financial aid refund, etc.

    • Constructor Detail

      • MoneyGain

        public MoneyGain(java.lang.String source,
                 double amount,
                 Frequency frequency,
                 java.util.Date nextDeposit,
                 java.util.Date endDate,
                 Account destination)
          throws BadBudgetInvalidValueException
        MoneyGain constructor. Verifies the passed values form a valid gain object first.
        Parameters:
        source - - Description of the source of this gain, cannot be null
        amount - - the amount of the gain, >= 0
        frequency - - How often the gain happens, if one time nextDeposit and end must be equal (or nextDeposit null) cannot be null
        nextDeposit - - the date of the next deposit, if null then no more deposits to handle only valid with one time freq. can occur after end date
        endDate - - the date to stop processing the gain. If frequency is one time, must match nextDeposit (unless nextDeposit null)
        destination - - the destination account, cannot be null
        Throws:
        BadBudgetInvalidValueException

    • Method Detail

      • verifyValues

        public static int verifyValues(java.lang.String source,
                               double amount,
                               Frequency frequency,
                               java.util.Date nextDeposit,
                               java.util.Date endDate,
                               Account destination)
        Error checking method for a money gain object. Reports the following errors using the corresponding error codes 0 - Values are valid 1 - Source is not set 2 - Amount is a negative value 3 - Frequency is not set 5 - Frequency is one time but end date is null (indicating ongoing) 7 - Next deposit is null but frequency is not one time 8 - Next deposit is not null and frequency is one time but end date doesn't match next deposit 6 - Destination is not set
        Parameters:
        source -
        amount -
        frequency -
        nextDeposit -
        endDate -
        destination -
        Returns:
        an integer representing an error in the data for the money gain or 0 if no errors were found

      • handleNextDeposit

        public void handleNextDeposit()
        Processes the next deposit. Takes the amount of the money gain and deposits it into the destination account. Updates the next deposit date using the frequency. Should check nextDeposit date first to verify this is desired.

      • calculateNextDeposit

        public java.util.Date calculateNextDeposit(java.util.Date lastDepositDate)
        Calculate the next deposit date using the given last deposit date and this money gain's frequency.
        Parameters:
        lastDepositDate - - the date the last deposit occurred
        Returns:
        - the next deposit date using the given last deposit. Returns null if a one time deposit.

      • addPredictData

        public void addPredictData(PredictDataMoneyGain mg)
        Add a row to the end of this money gain objects predict data list.
        Parameters:
        mg - - the predictData row to add (should correspond to a single date)

      • setPredictData

        public void setPredictData(int index,
                           PredictDataMoneyGain mg)
        Add a row to the money gain's predict data list at index
        Parameters:
        index - - the location to add the predict row at
        mg - - the predict row to add

      • getPredictData

        public PredictDataMoneyGain getPredictData(int dayIndex)
        Returns the row corresponding to the dayIndex passed in, in this moneyGain object PredictData list. MoneyGains predictData tells us when the nextDeposit will occur on the date corresponding to the row returned.
        Parameters:
        dayIndex - - the number of days since the start that we want the data for.
        Returns:
        PredictDataMoneyGain row in this object prediction list corresponding to the index passed in

      • update

        public void update(int dayIndex)
        After running the prediction algorithm this method updates this gain's next deposit date to the value's it would have on the day represented by day index.
        Parameters:
        dayIndex - - the day, as an offset from the start date used in the prediction algorithm, to update this gains values to.

      • updateNextDatesOnly

        public void updateNextDatesOnly(int dayIndex)
        Updates the next gain date for this gain.
        Parameters:
        dayIndex - - the day to update this gain to.
